title: Romy Teitzel
text:
Romy Teitzel (born 23 February 1999) is an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a for the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a> in the <a href="NRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NRL Women's Premiership</a> and the <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys%23North%20Queensland%20Gold%20Stars">North Queensland Gold Stars</a> in the <a href="QRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">QRL Women's Premiership</a>.
Background.
Teitzel was born in <a href="Townsville%2C%20Queensland">Townsville, Queensland</a> and played her junior rugby league for the Tully Tigers. Her father, <a href="Craig%20Teitzel">Craig</a>, played first grade for the <a href="Western%20Suburbs%20Magpies">Western Suburbs Magpies</a>, <a href="Illawarra%20Steelers">Illawarra Steelers</a>, <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington Wolves</a> and <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland Cowboys</a>.
Playing career.
In 2019, while playing for the Western Lions, Teitzel represented Queensland Country at the Women's National Championships.
In March 2020, Teitzel joined the <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys%23North%20Queensland%20Gold%20Stars">North Queensland Gold Stars</a> for their inaugural season, playing in their first game before the season was cancelled. She later played for the <a href="Wests%20Panthers">Wests Panthers</a> in the Holcim Cup.
In September 2020, she joined the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a> in the <a href="NRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NRL Women's Premiership</a>. In Round 3 of the <a href="2020%20NRL%20Women%27s%20season">2020 NRL Women's season</a>, she made her debut for the Broncos in their 24–16 win over the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a>.
In September 2021, Teitzel was named the <a href="QRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">BHP Premiership</a> Player of the Year.
